statement.p: What is the area of this floor in square feet?

solution.p: This floor area consists of a rectangular area (on the left) and a triangular area (on the right). First measurements should all be converted to the same unit.
Top edge: \displaystyle{14}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{11}\ \text{ in}={179}\ \text{ in}
Left edge: \displaystyle{5}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{7}\ \text{ in}={67}\ \text{ in}
Bottom edge: \displaystyle{10}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{10}\ \text{ in}={130}\ \text{ in}
We do not need the length of the right edge (angled).
The area of the rectangle is \displaystyle{\left({67}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({130}\ \text{ in}\right)}={8710}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

The triangles top edge has length \displaystyle{\left({179}\ \text{ in}\right)}-{\left({130}\ \text{ in}\right)}={49}\ \text{ in}. The left edge is 67 in. Thus the area of the triangle is \displaystyle\frac{{1}}{{2}}{\left({67}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({49}\ \text{ in}\right)}={1641.5}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

Thus the total area is \displaystyle{8710}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}+{1641.5}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}={10351.5}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}. Converting this to square feet it becomes \displaystyle{10351.5}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}\cdot{\left(\frac{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}\right)}^{{2}}=\frac{{10351.5}}{{144}}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}={71.885416666667}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}\approx{72}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}.
